items.title: Exercise 1: Recruitment Process Email (Doc A)
items.text:
Subject: Recruitment Update - Project Manager Position

Hi Team,

We have successfully completed the first round of candidate screening for the Project Manager vacancy. From a pool of 50 applicants, we have created a **shortlist** of 5 individuals who meet all our **SMART criteria**. 

The **interview panel** will consist of the Operations Director and the HR Lead. Logistics-wise, we need to coordinate schedules for next Tuesday. Please ensure that all candidates receive the pre-interview briefing pack and that their **reference checks** are initiated by EOD.

Following the interviews, we will enter the **onboarding** phase for the successful hire, starting with their 3-month **probationary period**.

Best regards,
HR Support Team

### Highlighted Vocabulary
1. **Shortlist**: A list of selected candidates from which a final choice will be made.
2. **SMART criteria**: Goals that are Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, and Time-bound.
3. **Interview Panel**: A group of people who interview a candidate for a job.
4. **Reference Checks**: Contacting previous employers to verify a candidate's history and performance.
5. **Onboarding**: The process of integrating a new employee into the organization.
6. **Probationary Period**: A trial period for a newly recruited employee.

questions.question: How many candidates were selected for the next stage?
questions.explanation: The email states they created a 'shortlist of 5 individuals'.

questions.question: What task must be completed by the end of the day (EOD)?
questions.explanation: The email says 'ensure that... their reference checks are initiated by EOD'.

items.prompt: Which term refers to the process of integrating a new employee into the company?
items.explanation: Onboarding (or induction) is the process of integrating new hires.

items.prompt: What does the 'S' in SMART goals stand for?
items.explanation: SMART stands for Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, and Time-bound.

items.prompt: Reported Speech: Transform this direct quote from a candidate into reported speech using 'asserted': 'I managed a team of ten in my previous role.'
items.modelAnswer: The candidate asserted that they had managed a team of ten in their previous role.

items.prompt: Reported Speech: Transform this manager's recommendation: 'You should attend the advanced Excel workshop next month.'
items.modelAnswer: The manager recommended that I attend the advanced Excel workshop next month.

items.prompt: If an employee's performance is below the required standard, they are experiencing:
items.explanation: Underperformance is when an employee fails to meet targets or standards.

items.prompt: Vocabulary: Use the term 'probationary period' in a sentence explaining a new hire's contract status.
items.modelAnswer: New employees must successfully complete a three-month probationary period before their permanent contract is confirmed.

items.prompt: Which document outlines the training and growth opportunities for an employee?
items.explanation: PDP stands for Professional Development Plan.

items.prompt: What is '360-degree feedback'?
options: Feedback given only by the CEO.
Feedback from peers, subordinates, and supervisors.
A feedback session that lasts 360 minutes.
Feedback given only at the end of the year.
items.explanation: 360-degree feedback involves multiple sources of evaluation around an employee.

items.prompt: Operational Logic: List three essential items an administrator must coordinate for a new hire's first day.
items.modelAnswer: 1. Asset provisioning (laptop/desk). 2. ID badge/access cards. 3. Compliance paperwork (contracts/NDAs).

questions.question: Which reporting verb does the speaker use to describe the manager's statement about the budget?
questions.explanation: The speaker says the manager 'confirmed' that the budget would increase.

questions.question: What is the employee's reaction to the 360-degree feedback?
options: They are surprised by the peer reviews.
They assert that the feedback is inaccurate.
They recommend a change in the appraisal cycle.
questions.explanation: The speaker mentions that the employee 'asserted' the feedback did not reflect their daily output.

questions.question: What 'asset provisioning' task is mentioned as a priority?
options: Issuing a laptop and access cards.
questions.explanation: The speaker emphasizes that the laptop and access cards must be ready for Day 1.

questions.question: How long is the induction session scheduled for?
questions.explanation: The speaker confirms the induction will take the 'entire morning session'.

items.prompt: What does 'Shortlisting' involve?
options: Selecting a small number of candidates for interview.
Increasing the salary for all staff.
items.explanation: Shortlisting is selecting the best candidates from a pool of applicants.

items.prompt: HR Terminology: Explain the difference between 'Retention' and 'Turnover'.
items.modelAnswer: Retention is the ability to keep employees, while turnover is the rate at which employees leave and are replaced.

items.prompt: Which of these is considered 'Gross Misconduct'?
options: Forgetting to cc a manager in an email.
Taking an extra 10 minutes for lunch.
items.explanation: Gross misconduct refers to very serious offenses like theft or violence.

items.title: Exercise 16: Performance Review Policy (Doc B)
items.text:
Doc B — Internal Memo: Annual Appraisal Cycle

The annual **appraisal cycle** begins in Q4. All managers must conduct one-on-one reviews with their direct reports to evaluate **KPIs** and set **SMART goals** for the next fiscal year. If an employee is found to be **underperforming**, they may be placed on a **Performance Improvement Plan (PIP)**. **High-flyers** who exceed expectations may be eligible for a **remuneration package** review.

### Highlighted Vocabulary
1. **Appraisal Cycle**: The fixed period (usually annual) for evaluating employee performance.
2. **KPIs (Key Performance Indicators)**: Quantifiable measures used to evaluate success.
3. **Underperforming**: Failing to reach the required standard of work.
4. **Performance Improvement Plan (PIP)**: A structured plan to help an employee improve their performance.
5. **High-flyer**: An employee with a lot of potential who is likely to be successful.
6. **Remuneration Package**: The total compensation (salary, bonus, benefits) an employee receives.

questions.question: When does the appraisal cycle start?
questions.explanation: The text states 'The annual appraisal cycle begins in Q4'.

questions.question: What happens to employees who are 'underperforming'?
options: They may be placed on a PIP.
questions.explanation: The text says they 'may be placed on a Performance Improvement Plan (PIP)'.

items.prompt: A 'High-flyer' is an employee who:
options: Has high potential and is very successful.
Always complains about the office temperature.
items.explanation: A high-flyer is someone with great potential and success.

items.prompt: Grammar: Report this question from a recruiter: 'Do you have experience with CRM software?' -> The recruiter inquired whether...
items.modelAnswer: The recruiter inquired whether I had experience with CRM software.

items.prompt: Which of these is part of a 'Remuneration Package'?
options: Salary, bonuses, and benefits like health insurance.
items.explanation: Remuneration includes the total compensation (salary, bonus, benefits).

items.prompt: Drafting: Write a 3-sentence email to a candidate who has NOT been shortlisted. Be polite and professional.
items.modelAnswer: Dear [Name], thank you for your application for the [Position] role. Unfortunately, we have decided not to move forward with your application at this time as we have shortlisted candidates who more closely match our requirements. We wish you the best in your job search.

items.prompt: To 'sign off on' a document means to:
options: Send it to the wrong person.
items.explanation: To sign off on something means to approve it officially.

items.prompt: Reported Speech: 'We must improve our talent retention rates.' -> The CEO emphasized that...
items.modelAnswer: The CEO emphasized that they had to improve their talent retention rates.

items.prompt: An 'Exit Interview' is conducted when an employee:
items.explanation: Exit interviews are held when someone leaves the company.

items.prompt: SMART Goals: Transform this vague goal into a SMART one: 'I want to be better at emails.'
items.modelAnswer: I will reduce my average email response time to under 4 hours by the end of Q3.

items.title: Exercise 25: Oral Recording - Interview Coordination Call
items.prompt: Record a voicemail for an internal manager (Sarah) regarding the upcoming Project Manager interviews. Mention the 'shortlist' of 5 candidates, the need to coordinate the 'interview panel' for next Tuesday, and use a reporting verb (e.g., 'HR emphasized...').
items.modelAnswer: Hi Sarah, I'm calling to coordinate the Project Manager interviews for next Tuesday. We've finalized a shortlist of 5 candidates, and HR has emphasized that we need to confirm the interview panel by EOD today. Could you let me know if you're available from 10 AM to 2 PM?

items.prompt: Reported Speech: 'I will be late for the induction session.' -> Mark stated that...
items.modelAnswer: Mark stated that he would be late for the induction session.

items.prompt: What does 'NDA' stand for?
items.explanation: NDA is a Non-Disclosure Agreement, a legal contract for confidentiality.

items.prompt: Vocabulary: Define 'Peer Review' in your own words.
items.modelAnswer: Peer review is an evaluation process where colleagues of the same level provide feedback on each other's work.

items.prompt: If a vacancy is 'filled', it means:
options: The office is full of people.
A candidate has been hired for the role.
The job description was too long.
items.explanation: To fill a vacancy means to hire someone for the open position.

items.prompt: Coordination: Write a short checklist (4 items) for an administrator preparing an interview room.
items.modelAnswer: 1. Confirm room booking. 2. Print CVs for the panel. 3. Provide water for the candidate. 4. Check audiovisual equipment for presentations.

items.title: Exercise 31: HR Reporting Standards (Doc C)
items.text:
Doc C — Best Practices: Documenting HR Meetings

When documenting interviews or appraisals, administrators must use objective language. We use sophisticated reporting verbs to clarify the speaker's intent. For example, if a candidate makes a strong claim, we report that they **asserted** or **claimed** a fact. If a manager suggests a course of action, we report that they **recommended** a specific path.

Confidentiality is paramount. All reports must be **signed off on** by the HR Lead before being added to the employee's file. This ensures **compliance** with data protection laws.

### Highlighted Vocabulary
1. **Asserted**: Stated a fact or belief confidently and forcefully.
2. **Sign off on**: To give official approval for something.
3. **Compliance**: The act of following legal rules, policies, or standards.

questions.question: According to Doc C, which verb is used when a manager suggests a course of action?
questions.explanation: The text states: 'If a manager suggests a course of action, we report that they recommended a specific path'.

questions.question: Who must 'sign off on' the HR reports before they are filed?
questions.explanation: Doc C specifies that reports must be signed off on by the HR Lead.

questions.question: What is the primary reason for having reports signed off by the HR Lead?
options: To ensure compliance with data protection laws.
questions.explanation: The text states that this process 'ensures compliance with data protection laws.'

items.prompt: Backshifting: 'We can't offer a higher salary.' -> They claimed that...
items.modelAnswer: They claimed that they couldn't offer a higher salary.

items.prompt: What is the primary goal of a 'Probationary Period'?
options: To evaluate if the employee is a good fit for the long term.
To make the employee work on weekends.
To train the employee for 5 years.
items.explanation: Probation is a trial period to assess performance and fit.

items.prompt: HR Reporting: A manager said: 'I am impressed with Sarah's initiative.' Report this to the HR Director.
items.modelAnswer: The manager stated that they were impressed with Sarah's initiative.

items.prompt: What is 'Compliance' in the context of HR?
options: The ability to speak many languages.
items.explanation: Compliance refers to adhering to laws, policies, and standards.

items.prompt: Logic: Why is 'Confidentiality' crucial when handling CVs and reference checks?
items.modelAnswer: Confidentiality is crucial to protect candidates' personal data and current employment status, preventing legal issues and maintaining professional trust.

items.prompt: To 'align with goals' means to:
options: Make sure everyone has the same desk.
Ensure tasks and behaviors support company objectives.
items.explanation: Alignment means ensuring effort is directed toward organizational targets.

items.prompt: Reported Speech: 'Are you available for a follow-up call tomorrow?' -> The recruiter asked if...
items.modelAnswer: The recruiter asked if I was available for a follow-up call the next day.

items.prompt: Which of these is a quantifiable 'KPI' for an administrator?

items.title: Exercise 40: Oral Recording - Performance Review Summary
items.prompt: You are an administrator reporting the results of a performance review to the HR Lead. Record a 60-second briefing. Mention if the employee 'exceeded expectations' or is 'underperforming', use a sophisticated reporting verb (e.g., 'The manager asserted...'), and mention their 'SMART goals' for the next year.
items.modelAnswer: Regarding Mark's appraisal, the manager asserted that he has consistently exceeded expectations in his Q3 KPIs. They have agreed on several SMART goals for next year, focusing on talent retention within his team. I've drafted his PDP and it's ready for your final sign-off.

items.prompt: A 'Reference Check' is performed to:
options: Check if the person is famous.
Verify a candidate's previous work history and conduct.
See if the candidate has any pets.
items.explanation: Reference checks verify the accuracy of a candidate's background.

items.prompt: Grammar (Advanced): Use 'recommended' to report this: 'Jane, you should lead the onboarding session.'
items.modelAnswer: The manager recommended that Jane lead the onboarding session.

items.prompt: What does 'Shortlist' mean?
options: A list of finalists selected for the next stage.
A list of people who are short on time.
items.explanation: A shortlist is the set of top candidates chosen from the total applicants.

items.prompt: Role Play: You are an HR Admin. Write a one-sentence response to an employee asking for their PDP status.
items.modelAnswer: I have checked the system, and your Professional Development Plan is currently awaiting sign-off from your department head.

items.title: Exercise 45: Weekly Review - Comprehensive HR Scenario
items.prompt: You are managing the onboarding of a 'High-flyer' and the offboarding of an employee who committed 'Gross Misconduct'. 1) List 3 'Asset Provisioning' tasks for the new hire. 2) Write a reported speech sentence regarding the misconduct dismissal. 3) Explain the purpose of an 'Exit Interview' for regular turnover.
items.modelAnswer: 1) Provisioning laptop, issuing access cards, and setting up the workstation. 2) The Director confirmed that the employee had been dismissed immediately for gross misconduct. 3) The purpose of an exit interview is to gather feedback on the employee's experience to improve retention and understand the reasons for turnover.
